sub_title: Leader in workplace health and wellbeing
summary: I am a passionate medical professional with extensive international health management experience in corporate, public and non-governmental organisations. I set strategy, drive change and bring together strategy and practice to achieve results that are meaningful to the organisation as a whole and the context in which it operates.

awards.title: GBCHealth Business Leadership Award
awards.description:
See http://archive.gbchealth.org/asset/award-winner-2012-heineken/
HEINEKEN was awarded the GBCHealth Business Leadership Award at the annual Conference and Dinner on May 15 in New York City. The most prestigious GBCHealth award, it is given annually to a business leader or company that has demonstrated an enduring commitment to and excellence in the effort to create a healthier world. "HEINEKEN is an unsung hero in Global Health,” said GBCHealth President and CEO John Tedstrom. “It is a corporate leader that has dedicated its energy, attention and resources over more than two decades to tackling some of the most challenging global health issues of our time.”

authors.headline: Leader in workplace health and wellbeing

profile_positions.description: Leading occupational health and safety as well as wellbeing in the workplace
profile_positions.title: Hoofd Arbodienst / Head Occupational Health department

profile_positions.description:
Lead 250 occupational health, medical and wellbeing employees across the world.
Accountable for the Global health and wellbeing policies and programs for 90 000 employees and contributing to the sustainability program. Responsible for health care for around 30 000 national employees and family members as well as for expats. 
Some achievements:
•	From January 2020 on leading the health response to COVID-19, communicating widely and setting health standards for operating companies. The Global employee climate score on the COVID response in November 2020 was exceptionally high.  
•	Under my direction, over 40 company clinics in locations with limited existing care, now provide quality care for over 30 000 employees and families. All clinics in Africa implemented international level emergency care and the SafeCare quality system by 2020. The clinics achieved HIV control in over 90% of patients by 2018 as well as hypertension and diabetes control in 85%. 
•	The HIV prevention and treatment programme running in over 20 company clinics in Africa since 2002 received international recognition through the GBCHealth Business Leadership Award in 2012 and The Amsterdam Diner Award in 2019.
•	To enable work in high risk locations, I provide distance health care for expats and business travellers eg in Africa. The care has consistently high satisfaction scores while health insurance cost were half of that of similar companies in 2019 and 2020.
•	In 2018 I accelerated the wellbeing program, providing structure, evidence-based guidelines and training. By 2020, 93% of operating companies had a comprehensive wellbeing program addressing physical and mental health.  
•	I built external relationships with global health organisations like the Global Fund against AIDS TB and malaria and facilitated four public private co-operations on health care logistics.
profile_positions.title: Global Director Health (Chief Medical Officer)

profile_positions.description:
Led 250 occupational health and safety and medical employees across the world.
Accountable for the Global health and safety policies and programs for 90 000 employees and contributing to the sustainability program. Responsible for health care for around 30 000 national employees and family members as well as for expats. 
Some achievements:
•	See under the role from 2018 onward
•	Before 2012 occupational safety only covered production sites. I expanded it across the entire organisation and it became a top company priority, a sustainability pillar and accidents reduced from 1.63 accidents/100 FTE in 2014 to 1.18 in 2018.
profile_positions.title: Global Director Health and Safety

profile_positions.description:
I supervised the medical facilities at Heineken subsidiaries in Africa and Asia, where individual health care is given to employees and their family members with a focus on HIV. 
Maintained the quality of the Heineken medical facilities in countries like Nigeria, Ivory Coast, Sierra Leone, DRC, Rwanda, Burundi, Ethiopia, Cambodia, Laos, Solomon Islands, and Haiti through data gathering, training and direct supervision.
profile_positions.title: Medical Adviser

profile_positions.description:
I worked at the Health Inspectorate at the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sports, The Netherlands (Now IGJ).
I was in charge of supervision of public health services in the Netherlands and advising the MoH on matters concerning public health services and local public health. The work entailed doing regulatory inspections, thematic surveys and analysing  public health crises response.
profile_positions.title: Co-ordinating Health Inspector for Public Health

profile_positions.description:
At the Infectious disease control department GGD, Amsterdam The Netherlands, 
I set up and was in charge of the institute that coordinates the care provide by travel health care providers in The Netherlands, as well as being in charge of the largest travel clinic in the Netherlands.  
The job entailed making national guidelines on travel vcinations and malaria prophylaxis. It also included general communication and working with stakeholders to promote the use of pre-travel health services by travellers and coordinating with similar institutes in other countries as well as presenting at conferences, publishing in journals and doing research on travel medicine.
profile_positions.title: Medical Doctor / Director  LCR (National Coordination Centre Travel health)

profile_positions.description:
I worked for Médecins Sans Frontières Holland Amsterdam The Netherlands.
Carried out various emergency and longer term projects in South Sudan I worked in a project fighting Kala Azar (Visceral Leishmaniasis).
In Cambodia, I worked in various locations doing clinical care and project managment, for example in tuberculosis, malaria, emergency care, as well as preventive services. Carrying out health care rehabilitation projects funded by USAID and otehr donors.
profile_positions.title: Medical Doctor / Project Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.role: Member of the Private Sector Delegation Advisory Group
volunteer_experiences.description:
Over the past decade, the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria has helped save millions of lives around the world. The private sector has played a vital role in this private-public partnership.

The Private Sector Delegation (PSD) is a group of companies that brings the business voice to the Global Fund and helps shape the strategy of the leading funding agency in global health. 

http://www.gbchealth.org/focal-point-roles/global-fund-private-sector-delegation/

company.name: International Society of Travel Medicine ISTM

volunteer_experiences.description:
Scientific Committee of 6th Conference of the ISTM in Geneva in 1997. 
Founding member of the interest group travel for work since 2018.
Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) 403: Project Group revising the OSH Standard in 2017.
Advisory council sets the guidelines for travel health preventive measures and quality standards for travel health clinics in the Netherlands
Board member of StopTB Board at WHO, representing the private sector
MPH network “PHNed” in the Netherlands, Board Member and chair 2007-2012.

Any person whose interests are directly affected by a decision taken by the
Executive Director of the Stichting Aidsfonds – Soa Aids Nederland concerning
Aidsfonds (‘Aidsfonds’) on the allocation of a grant is entitled to appeal against this
decision by lodging an appeal in good time with the Aidsfonds’ Executive Director.
The appellant should submit five copies of the notice of the appeal, that should be
addressed to the Appeals Committee. The Appeals Committee is authorised to
review all decisions taken by the Executive Director in relation to grant
applications, with the exception of decisions on requests for individual support.
